anime.description: The "Royal Tutor" is a special tutor carefully selected for the task of teaching the prince, and a title given only to the best teacher in the nation. Heine Wittgenstein has been called to the kingdom of Grannzreich to take on the role of the Royal Tutor. He`s been ordered to raise a worthy candidate for the throne, but he`s greeted with four princes of completely different, unique personalities... all brothers, no less! How will Heine handle these four brothers who were too much for all the previous Royal Tutors, prompting them all to run away from the job? Source: crunchyroll

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: aristocrat
tag.description: An aristocrat or noble is a member of the aristocracy or nobility, an upper class in feudal societies. Nobles may or may not hold any specific nobility title. For simplicity`s sake, royalty should also be considered nobility.

tag.name: bishounen
tag.description: Young man whose beauty (and sexual appeal) transcends the boundary of gender or sexual orientation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: fetishes
tag.description: Everything under fetishes (except for Bishounen and Juujin) is strictly only meant for hentai (18 Restricted) and ecchi anime. In case of ecchi, it must be the main element of the show and not when there`s only some of it, for example, there`s some ecchi in Shinseiki Evangelion, but the fact you get to see Asuka`s pantsu doesn`t warrant it the schoolgirl fetish category. So be careful to which ecchi show you add fetishes; it`s fairly straightforward with hentai, though. Overall, this category tree is to satisfy the needs of people with different fetishes, so they can search for what tingles their tangle; hence why this is restricted to hentai and full ecchi shows.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: past
tag.description: Anime that takes place in the past or clearly seems to take place in the past in case of an alternative universe. This category should almost always go together with one of its sub-categories, because the past can either be a depiction of a historical event(s) or not, in which case it would be alternative past.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: alternative past
tag.description: An anime that takes place in an alternative past is an anime that clearly does not belong to the future or the present, and isn`t tied particularly closely to our history, or has ties to our history but only as a premise: there are too many things that don`t make sense for the time-period. In some cases there is futuristic technology present, but the overall setting still feels that of the past. However the setting must still take place on Earth, since we can not know if the history of a fantasy world is an alternate one or not.

tag.name: historical
tag.description: Historical anime have clear ties to our history and usually occur in a particular epoch.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: Europe
tag.description: Europe is a continent located entirely in the Northern Hemisphere and mostly in the Eastern Hemisphere. It is bordered by the Arctic Ocean to the north, the Atlantic Ocean to the west, and the Mediterranean Sea to the south. It comprises the westernmost part of Eurasia. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: daily life
tag.description: The antics of the protagonists do not take place in some exotic setting or time, but in everyday life. When not "at the job" this means getting up in the morning, making meals, house cleaning, going shopping or out to eat, visiting the bath house or spa, leisure activities in the spare time, etc. The time "on the job" for students is School Life, for others working in their profession. Daily Life is basically a synonym for everything normal, repetitive, and trivial happening to your average person.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

episode.title: 王子, 街へ行く
The Princes Go to Town
Les princes en ville
Ouji, Machi e Iku
episode.summary: Today`s lesson: an incognito field trip into the royal capital! The sheltered princes are excited right out of the gate, but it looks like they might be scheming something behind their tiny teacher`s back... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 認めなくてもいいので
You Don`t Need to Accept Me
Que vous m’acceptiez ou pas
Mitomenakute mo Ii node
episode.summary: Heine has finished interviewing all four princes and is ready to begin his first lesson, but will his young charges all assemble for it? And how did they do on their tests?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 王子面談
The Prince Interviews
Les entretiens
Ouji Mendan
episode.summary: Royal tutor Heine has been tasked with grooming four princes into potential kings. He’s interviewed the proud Prince Leonhard, but three more princes await: the highly intelligent Bruno, freewheeling Licht, and perpetually-glaring Kai. With each prince`s personality as unique as the last, interviewing them will prove to be anything but straightforward... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 王室教師, 来る
The Royal Tutor Arrives
L`arrivée du précepteur royal
Oushitsu Kyoushi, Kuru
episode.summary: The kingdom of Glanzreich is at the height of prosperity. The palace employs a tutor to give its princelings an exhaustive education and groom them into fit candidates for the throne, and the prestigious post of royal tutor is bestowed upon only the best and brightest teachers from throughout the kingdom. When Heine Wittgenstein arrives at Weisburg Palace to take charge of four picture-perfect princes as the new royal tutor, he quickly learns that he’ll have his work cut out for him--for looks and reputations can be most deceiving indeed. Can Heine whip them into shape? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 臆病な心
A Timid Heart
Un cœur timide
Okubyou na Kokoro
episode.summary: Ever since the king pointed out Prince Kai`s communication problems, the second prince has been confused about how exactly to go about improving them. Professor Heine and the prince`s brothers have some advice for him, but can Kai muster the courage to put it into practice? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 夢の在処
The Whereabouts of a Dream
La voie des rêves
Yume no Arika
episode.summary: From a young age, Prince Bruno has poured his utmost efforts into his studies to catch up with the crown prince who everyone saw as a genius. So when little brother Leonhard shows signs of genius, too--however unbelievable that may be--he panics. Can Heine help the brainiac prince decide what he really wants out of life? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: カフェ・ミッター・マイヤーにて
At Cafe Mitter Meyer
Au café Mitter Meyer
Cafe Mitter Meyer nite
episode.summary: When he was a sickly child, Licht was always waiting in his bed for a certain person to visit... While strolling about the city one day, Heine steps inside a charming cafe--and the waiter who greets him is Prince Licht`s spitting image! Is Licht`s secret still safe, or is he in big trouble with the king? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 最大の試練, 襲来
Assailed by the Greatest of Trials
La plus grande des épreuves
Saidai no Shiren, Shuurai
episode.summary: When King Viktor--also known as the war hero king--returns to the palace after a long time away, he summons Heine and the princes for an audience. But he isn`t quite what one might imagine from his nickname... and he has some choice words for his tutor-spurning sons, especially Leonhard! With his claim to the throne on the line, can Leonhard get through the trial his father puts before him? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 最後の授業
The Last Lesson
Le dernier cours
Saigo no Jugyou
episode.summary: Heine has resigned from the post of royal tutor, and the search for his replacement is underway. Can the princes prove that they’ve matured under his tutelage? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 二人の約束
The Pair`s Promise
La promesse
Futari no Yakusoku
episode.summary: Professor Heine sends the princes on an assignment to investigate rumors of a criminal in the palace, and the truth shocks them. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 僕の知らない先生
The Professor I Don`t Know
Sa face cachée
Boku no Shiranai Sensei
episode.summary: Little by little, the problem princes have been facing their flaws and learning more about themselves as Professor Heine grooms them for the throne. But when Count Rosenberg makes another appearance, they realize there`s one thing they still know nothing about: the royal tutor himself... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 過去の代償
The Price of the Past
Le prix du passé
Kako no Daishou
episode.summary: One year ago, Prince Kai was suspended from military school for violent misconduct. Now the incident is back to haunt him in the form of a tabloid article. Can Kai overcome his past by truly confronting it? Source: crunchyroll
